name: Pan Pacific Singapore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for a 2 night stay after travelling around Australia for 4 months as we fancied a bit of luxury before going home and boy did we find it. The Hotel was beautiful, we were given a free upgrade upon arrival and were on floor 33. This meant getting the outside glass lifts which are not for those afraid of heights but what a view over the city. The room was wonderful, clean, good soundproofing and lots of little extras like bath salts, slippers and bath robes. It is situated perfectly and we could walk everywhere with a little help from the staff as to what door to take...there are loads as this is one huge hotel. The breakfast was lovely, fresh and every choice you could think of. In fact the only negative I could think of would be the cost of drinks in the lounge but for a top notch hotel like this it really was to be expected and certainly wouldn't put me off of going again.
reviews.title: Wow what a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Pan Pacific for two nights in December en-route to New Zealand. Can not fault this hotel in any way it was excellent. We were allowed to check in very early (9am) which was a bonus and we found that the staff from the check-in to the porters were exteremely friendly and helpful.The hotel is amazing with fantastic star wars style lifts and lots of marble decor everywhere ! We booked a deluxe room and it was lovely. Huge super kingsize bed and very spacious room and bathroom, We didnt eat at the hotel as there is so much choice right outside. The hotel has two shopping centres next to it infact you can access one directly from the hotel and there is a 7-11 accross the road if you fancy snacks etc for your room. Would not hesitate to recommend or return to this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: First stay at the Pan Pacific. I was travelling alone on Business. Since there are a number of reviews on the hotel I thought I would focus on the Pan Pacific Club Floor. Simply, the Hotel and Staff were excellent. The Club floor rooms are on upper floor of the Hotel providing outstanding views of the city. Upon arriving at the hotel you go the the Pacific Club Desk and are then escorted to a private checkin area on the 33rd floor. The elevators to the checkin desk are on the exterior face of the building offering spectacular views of the city. Upon checkin you will be greeted by the most hospitable of hosts who will remember you name the entire stay. You will recieve a cool fresh fruit drink and towel while being quickly checked in. Staying on the Pacific Club floor offers a number of ammenities that make it worth the additional price. First there are lounges on the 33rd and 34th floor for Pan Pacific Club guests. The 33rd Floor Lounge is open 24 hours with complimentary coffee, tea , juice and light snacks. Complimentary is the theme while staying on these floors... Choice of breakfast is served on the 33rd floor ( American) , the Lobby Lounge ( Continental) ; Global Kitchen Restaurant ( Buffet) or in-room dining. There is afternoon tea ( 3-5PM), Cocktails and Hors d'Oeuvres ( 5:30-7 PM) and Liquor Service ( 8-10) on the 34th Floor Club. In addition there is a complimentary in-room mini-bar stocked daily with beer, Liquor, water and soda. Internet access and local calls as well as the pressing of 3 garments are also complementary. The rooms are very spacious and well appointed. Plenty of storage as there are two closets and numerous dresser draws. There is an ironing board and iron in each room. The room has a large flat panel TV and DVD player. The Bathroom is very large and luxurious. Marble everywhere. L'occitane bath products , hair dryer, shaving kits , tooth brush and paste are included. There is a seperate shower and bath. There are a number of very good restaurants in the hotel. Even with all the ammenties the outstanding service throughout the hotel is what really stood out.
reviews.title: Pacific Club Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After staying here twice during November I came away having enjoyed my stay but not as much as I might have. The main plus points for Pan Pacific are their reasonable internet rates and the superb friendly attitude of the staff who really can't do enough to help you. The hotel also features modern well proportioned rooms and a pretty good location, breakfast if included in the rate is extensive but otherwise I would opt for one of the coffee shops in the adjoining mall. The down sides were painfully slow lifts and problems during check out such as having to correct discrepencies in the room rate or having the bill presented in my home currency when I had requested it in SGD.
reviews.title: Decent value

reviews.text: This is a fabulous hotel with fantastic customer service. When we arrived, we were taken to our room by the customer relations manager who checked us in from our room. Each day our room was cleaned, bed made or changed, and the chamber maid checked if we wanted new towels every afternoon. Whatever our needs the hotel accommodated and gave plenty of advice. By the pool, fresh bottled water was always provided, together with cold towels to freshen up with and fruit. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes to stay in a modern and beatiful building in a good location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My vision was of resting on the bed or sitting on a chair and looking at the harbour.
reviews.title: Just Perfect !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Pan Pacific website says: "Travelers will enjoy the availability of Panoramic rooms offering panoramic views and balcony rooms that feature dazzling views of the Marina Bay harbour and Singapore's financial district."
reviews.title: great location, good hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stopped off at the Pan Pacific on our way to Sydney on honeymoon for two nights. Arriving at about 9am we thought we were going to have to leave our bags and check in later but the hotel staff could not have been more helpful and we were checked straight in (took no more than 10 mins).
reviews.title: Well worth the stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were impressed with the room, clean, spacious and a nice cityscape from our floor to ceiling windows. The only minor problem was the shower door leaking but as I say this was only minor.
reviews.title: We'll be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool was good, especially the staff who were ultra efficient. Although we did not have the chance to use many of the other facilities there was plenty on offer.
reviews.title: Even Exceeded Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did however visit the Global Kitchen in the hotel and although the food was good it was very expensive (£10 for two cokes) as well as the service being slow. This said we did complete an online survey from the hotel and are convinced this will be addressed (they have even said there will be a bottle of wine waiting for us should we ever return).
reviews.title: Perfect hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The location of the hotel was ideal with easy access to countless shopping malls (there are hundreds!), the Singapore Eye and the harbour. Raffels and Orchard Road were all well within easy walking distance.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel!

likes.liked: — Modern, stylish, clean, excellent location and view; excellent price for the luxury
likes.disliked: — Expensive internet if you don't have your own laptop and want to use the business centre (then again, maybe it's like that everywhere and Singapore is just expensive)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: What a hotel! Just a quick note on the place. The building is unbelieveable, the decor is top quality and really does make you feel small! Great staff, nice pool and facilities. Only slight issue I would have would be the internet connection, but please don't let that put you off.
reviews.title: What a hotel!
Good location, especially for shoppers
reviews.text: The Pan Pacific is located in Marina Square, adjacent to a shopping mall that connects to another shopping mall that connects to another shopping mall, and another...well, you get the picture. Singapore is known for its shopping opportunities and this hotel allows both the shopper and the sightseer to enjoy themselves. You can literally walk for miles underground, or surface and visit the Esplanade (river area) or Boat Quay/Clark Quay before returning to airconditioned spendor of the vast underground.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I travel to Singapore every year and this is my first stay at Pan Pacific. If you like to walk, you can get around the city on foot easily from this hotel, or you can use the MRT/public transport (train) which is very user friendly. Taxis are very inexpensive but traffic can be tough.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel was very nice, a good 4*. I snagged it at a great rate of US$120 when other hotels (lesser or equal ones) cost $180 or more. It's comparable to Swissotel and better than the M or the Amara.
reviews.title: Wow!

likes.liked: — We felt like we were staying in an apartment overlooking Singapore!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was a good size, soothing in decor. It was typically outfitted in standard 4* comforts. Big shower stall was a pleasure to use (no tub). The outdoor pool was nice, as was the dry sauna in the pool area.
reviews.title: Unbelievable building

description: Perfectly located at the gateway to the Central Business District and Singapore’s financial area, Pan Pacific Singapore provides a convenient base to explore this vibrant city. Soaring high above the heart of Marina Bay and the Suntec City Singapore International Convention and Exhibition Centre, Pan Pacific Singapore draws on Oriental influences and infuses them with the Pacific Touch.
